text: China Central Television or Chinese Central Television, commonly abbreviated as CCTV, is the major state television broadcaster in mainland China.Barboza, David. "Olympics Are Ratings Bonanza for Chinese TV," New York Times. August 21, 2008; retrieved 2011-11-21. CCTV has a network of 50 channels. Each channel broadcasts different programs to more than one billion viewers.CCTV, "About us"; retrieved 2011-11-22. The CCTV programs are a mixture of documentary, comedy, entertainment, and drama. ==History== CCTV Peking (Beijing) Television (北京电视台) broadcast its first program on September 2, 1958. The network changed its name to CCTV on May 1, 1978. ==Related pages== * CCTV New Year's Gala ==References== == Other websites == * CCTV Live Site * CCTV Official Site * CCTV-News * CCTV-E * CCTV-F * CCTV-Arabic * CCTV-Pусский * CCTV News Channel Site Category:Television networks Category:Companies of the People's Republic of China
